  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath1 be an even ( respectively , odd ) dimensional complex vector space equipped with a nondegenerate skew - symmetric ( respectively , symmetric ) bilinear form .",
    "let @xmath0 denote the grassmannian which parametrizes the isotropic subspaces of @xmath1 .",
    "the cohomology ring @xmath2 is generated by certain special schubert classes , which for us are ( up to a factor of two ) the chern classes of the universal quotient vector bundle over @xmath0 .",
    "these special classes also generate the small quantum cohomology ring @xmath3 , a @xmath4-deformation of @xmath2 whose structure constants are given by the three point , genus zero gromov - witten invariants of @xmath0 . in @xcite",
    ", we proved a giambelli formula in @xmath2 , that is , a formula expressing a general schubert class as an explicit polynomial in the special classes .",
    "our goal in the present work is to extend this result to a formula that holds in @xmath3 .    the quantum giambelli formula for the usual type a grassmannian was obtained by bertram @xcite , and is in fact identical to the classical giambelli formula . in the case of maximal isotropic grassmannians ,",
    "the corresponding questions were answered in @xcite .",
    "the main conclusions here are similar to those of loc .",
    ", provided that one uses the raising operator giambelli formulas of @xcite as the classical starting point . for an odd orthogonal grassmannian , we prove that the quantum giambelli formula is the same as the classical one .",
    "the result is more interesting when @xmath0 is the grassmannian @xmath5 parametrizing @xmath6-dimensional isotropic subspaces of a symplectic vector space @xmath1 of dimension @xmath7 .",
    "our theorem in this case states that the quantum giambelli formula for @xmath5 coincides with the classical giambelli formula for @xmath8 , provided that the special schubert class @xmath9 is replaced with @xmath10 . in a sequel to this paper",
    ", we will discuss the classical and quantum giambelli formulas for even orthogonal grassmannians .",
    "[ [ section ] ]    choose @xmath11 and consider the grassmannian @xmath12 of isotropic @xmath6-dimensional subspaces of @xmath13 , equipped with a symplectic form .",
    "a partition @xmath14 is _",
    "@xmath15-strict _ if all of its parts greater than @xmath15 are distinct integers .",
    "following @xcite , the schubert classes on @xmath16 are parametrized by the @xmath15-strict partitions whose diagrams fit in an @xmath17 rectangle ; we denote the set of all such partitions by @xmath18 . given any partition @xmath19 and a complete flag of subspaces @xmath20 such that @xmath21 for @xmath22 , we have a schubert variety @xmath23 where @xmath24 denotes the number of ( non - zero ) parts of @xmath25 and @xmath26 this variety has codimension @xmath27 and defines , via poincar duality , a schubert class @xmath28 $ ] in @xmath29 .",
    "the schubert classes @xmath30 for @xmath31 form a free @xmath32-basis for the cohomology ring of @xmath16 .",
    "the _ special schubert classes _ are defined by @xmath33=c_r({{\\mathcal q}})$ ] for @xmath34 , where @xmath35 denotes the universal quotient bundle over @xmath16 .",
    "the classical giambelli formula for @xmath16 is expressed using young s _ raising operators _ @xcite .",

    "@xmath48 holds in the cohomology ring of @xmath5 .",

    "vertical ) strip if it does not contain two boxes in the same column ( resp .",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a symplectic or odd orthogonal grassmannian which parametrizes isotropic subspaces in a vector space equipped with a nondegenerate ( skew ) symmetric form . </S>",
    "<S> we prove quantum giambelli formulas which express an arbitrary schubert class in the small quantum cohomology ring of @xmath0 as a polynomial in certain special schubert classes , extending the cohomological giambelli formulas of @xcite . </S>"
  ]
}
